reviewText:
My favourite racing sim for years. A must have for any racing sim and classic car fans.

Community still alive and kicking, plenty of mods around.
For online racing, your best bet is to find a group that has scheduled events. I race(d) at racedepartment.com, great guys there. Even got a few poles and wins; every single one of them in the Mini :D
voteText: 41 of 43 people (95%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A huge THANK YOU to whoever had a part in bringing this amazing game and the GTR games to Steam - you deserve a standing ovation.

If you missed this classic gem and have ANY interest or appreciation of racing sims, now is the time to get it. GT Legends and GTR 2 are still as good as every other racing game available, and for my 2 cents the only games that top them are still being made. The initial package brings a lot to the table but the daunting collection of cars and tracks from the sim-racing community available makes it an absolute must-have.

This is racing...  get in it
voteText: 26 of 27 people (96%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is the sim racer I have been looking for, good selection of classic cars from small fiats to big american muscle. Has a decent selection of tracks, ai drivers are a decent challenge where they will try pass other drivers in smart places and not just push you off the track like a horny moose.

The biggest thing for me is that this game has great driving physics. Cars handle like you think they would. When you drive a small front wheel drive car you notice how nimble it is through the corners and has very little understeer and the bigger american muscle cars feel heavy with lots of torque. There are close to 100 different cars and you unlock them as you play through the career. You can adjust almost everything on them either with simple sliders for oversteer/understeer, stiffness and ride height to more advanced setup where you can change camber and so on.

Graphics are ok with decent textures and nice lighting effects for the time. Exterior damage modelling is very minimal but collisions do feel like they have some weight to them even though sometimes side to side collisions can feel a bit akward, but still you can push cars and make them spin. Very playable with older hardware and newer aswell. Also supports 21:9 aspect ratio monitors. Driving feels nice even with a gamepad, though oversteer can be difficult to control with such sensitive controls. I would recommend a good FFB wheel with this. I have not personally tested how it is with a wheel but support for all kinds of wheels and controllers are there and are very configurable with sensitivity, dead zones and so on. (I will try to add my thoughts later on about how it feels with a wheel since at the moment I don't have a good place to install my Fanatec CSR wheels, pedals and shifter.)

My favorite moments from the game are when you are playing the david vs goliath" on career mode where you have to drive with a small and not too powerfull Lotus Cortina against big muscle cars like The Mustang. In the straightaways you get passed easily but if you carry lots of speed through the corners you can almost oversteer past them.

The game is very moddable
date: nogrip and other forums has a ton of beatifully modelled cars and tracks
voteText: true
votesHelpful: 19 of 19 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Game is perfect, no other word for it. It has everything going for it, there's not 1 bad thing about this game.

1) Cockpit view is amazing.

2) Night time racing is awesome.

3) Night time racing in a convertible with cockpit view is one of the best experiences i've had in a racing game.

4) Night time racing in a black Chevrolet Corvette in cockpit view (windscreen is incredibly narrow) is absolute boss. Unbelievably good.

5) The endurance races (20/60 laps) don't feel like endurance races because every second is great.

5) The handling is perfect. The cars don't feel like a yacht, but you can't just throw them around either. It is balanced perfectly.

6) Moving up in cars is great. Going from a Lotus Cortina, to a Ford Mustang, to a Chevrolet Corvette, to a Ford GT is great.  The speed difference is notable in each jump, and the engine noises, especially from Cortina to Mustang, is awesome.

7) Physics are crazy. You can easily flip or roll the car, but that adds to the fun.

8) No popularity simulator single player crap like most modern racing games have, just simple trophies.

9) Great selection of cars and tracks.

reviewText:
Intro/Graphics: If you love old cars (or just cars) and challenging racing, this is for you. This game is from 2005, so the graphics are outdated, although that doesn't bother me. I find the tracks and landscape suffer the most, but the cars themselves look great! The lighting is particularly good on the cars and everywhere else. You can race anytime of day, and night races are fun (I always end up breaking a headlight tho *oops*). Though, you cannot race in the rain unlike GTR2, however this is okay because driving these 60s/70s cars in the rain would be a struggle.

Controls/Difficulty: I got this game a long time ago before I was even old enough to fit in a driver's seat (much to the disdain of the elder British lads that I wrecked in multiplayer long ago), but I enjoyed it oh so much. If you are playing it with a keyboard, good luck racing on professional or semi-pro mode. With a keyboard, you pretty much need traction control, automatic shifting, and anti-lock brakes, therefore you can only be competitive on amateur difficulty. If you have a wheel and pedals and a shifter, then it'll be awesome, especially if you have a clutch pedal and H shifter. There's really no need to play on novice or beginner difficulty unless you really are new to racing games or are just a young kid. (Fun fact: it took me until this year to learn how to pit, however you won't really need to until the endurance races)

Physics/Realism: The driving physics are rather good. The crashes are very unrealistic however and it's very easy to flip your car and roll about five times before landing on your roof (and still being able to drive afterwards). Glitches are pretty fun, as well.

Gameplay: You go through a career mode where you race from 2 to 8 circuits per event and accumulate points and win a trophy if you finish between first and third in points at the end. You start with a Mini and a Lotus Cortina and race up to faster cars (Mustang, Elan, Corvette, Pantera, 911... etc.) by either winning them or earning enough credits to buy new (old) cars. You also unlock more tracks along the way. I haven't played multiplayer in such a long time, but back in the day I used to joyride in my Ford Falcon on the grass & dirt (on purpose) at Donington Park. The Europeans loved me.


tl;dr ~
You can drive (wreck) cars that are now worth millions!

reviewText:
Haven't played much but i was really excited to review this.

Such a good game, a really old game i believe it was released in 2005 (Don't quote me on that but i'm sure i read it somewhere) Deffo worth the purchase, i picked my copy up for a quid at 90% off during a sale. I used my steering wheel and pedals, although you will need an advanced wheel-pedal-gearbox controller for this, unforchantly i do not have a gearbox but i made do. Really good game. 8/10.

Good:

; Graphics
; Gameplay
; Racing

Bad:

8/10 Would play again.

reviewText:
Good: This game was released 2005 and it's still good in year 2014. Graphics? not up to par by todays standards in any ways but everything else is still golden.  Attention to detail is Simbin quality and i love the nice career mode. No other Simbin game has a proper career mode with unlockable cars and tracks.

Bad: Hard to find anything bad that isn't nit picking or whining about graphics. FPS turns on a dime even on my older rig.

Does not record your playing hours correctly though. Steam overlay does not always activate so the real game hours are always understated unless you Alt-tab out after starting the game and check that you are marked as playing the game every time.

Also ugly orange colored menus. Like you watch much those anyways...

reviewText:
Finally a game that takes a look back in the car racing history! If you love racing simulators, you don't want to miss this one!!

There are just so many options in the car setup before the race, you can adjust anything.

The gameplay itself is also amazing. It's so realistic that when you plug in your steering wheel you can't believe it's a game.

Graphics are also very cool, cars are shiny. Only thing that's kind of a downer are the collisions.. They are not realistic at all. But overall it's a pretty good racing game

I'd give it 9/10.

reviewText:
Decided to uppdate the review of the game to look a bit better ;3

Okey, why is this game good? well.. for once this game got me into racing games. I started playing this game at the age of 5 thanks to my father. he bought one of those Microsoft Sidewinder FB wheels to use with the game. i spent days just watching my father play this game for hours. untill i asked if i could test play. sure i was short so i could not reach down to the pedals so i had to use the buttons on the steering wheel. it was hard i got to admit at the age of 6-8 i could finnaly reach down to the pedals and be able to drive the cars in manual. i spend thousands of hours into the game. i beated the game on every diffeculty at that point my father bough one of those ♥♥♥♥♥♥ computers you got from work. and bough a second copy of the game and another wheel. for him. and we decided to go head to head on each other. he was always faster and always better then me. so i decided to skip school... just to be able to beat him in the game. it was a bad idea really bad idea.

but i did beat him. with the legendary Ford GT40. that is where i fell in love with cars. my dream back then was to get my self a GT40 but yea guess where that dream went. however the game features alot of old school cars like BMW, De Pantera, Ford, Jaguar, Abarth, Ferrari, Porsche. now you might ask. Why the ♥♥♥♥ is this dude talking about all of this?" well... the answer is. i grew up with this game. i have spent more hours into this game then i have spent on any game in my steam library combined. (dont let the steam time fool you. this was before it was on steam) the game comes with 16 diffrent car manufactures. 11 tracks + short version or long versions. the game allows modding to any part. The online community is still alive and kicking but you need to play in a group. or just have LUCK that someone is still having a public server open.

But why do i acctualy rekommend the game?

well... take it like this... there are not many games that takes you back to the 1960s and 1970s most games today are just about graphics and DLC's. this game dont give two ♥♥♥♥♥ about that. NO DLC's pure Simulator game. the engine might be outdated and the physics in the game might be ♥♥♥♥ing dumb somtimes. but it's a great game. the ai's are acctualy tough and will do anything just to get to first place. even if it means that they have to push you off the track...

Sadly the game DO lack some features. like blue flag. black flag. yellow flag. you dont have the options to change the settings in the game. like the diffeculty of the AI. if you choose proffesional you will have hard ai's no matter what. the game are missing some cars that was in the 60 and the 70 racing with these classes. but there is mods out there that adds those cars. i higly rekommend atleast test the game (downloading illegaly or borrowing a friends copy) and the sound in the game is just PURE porn. the corvette C2 sounds just pure amazing. i do rekommend playing trough the game vanilla BEFORE you start modding it."

reviewText:
The racing game I always return to.
Whether it is starting from the back of a full grid of easy AI or trying to make it to the end of a full length endurance race there is much fun to be had here.
The variety of cars makes this my favourite of all SimBins games, GTR2 would be a close runner up, anything after that doesn't come close.
If you are familiar with any of the ISI engine games you will know what to expect from the handling, the attention to detail for each of the cars interiors means you will want to own and try them all - its up to you if you want to earn the money to buy them or use the savegame trick to unlock them for nothing.

reviewText:
Worth 2USD price, but demands a wheel. Pretty, great cars+music, backed by community content, but poor personal experience.

-Downloaded tracks were inaccessible (grayed-out). Broken control-stick sensitivity (adjusting did nothing). Cars felt like traction control was off (even with assists). Bugs: HUD did not work, turn-assist indicator was wrong many times, showing wrong gear to be in, appearing too early/late or not at all.

Controller (Logitech F310) might explain sensitivity issues, but these GT cars felt like muscle cars. Getting on brakes with any seriousness at times felt like I was driving on bald tires.

Suggestions: 1-Get a wheel  2-Download car tuning files 3-Drive conservatively 4-Practice like hell; the AI is on rails

Feel let down by reviews; Don't have much PC racing experience, but this seems overrated. This is what you would have called a rental game, one weekend and then tossed in the return bin.

reviewText:
Let’s start out with two points:-

For the basis of this discussion, Dictionary.com defines ‘simulation’ as: -
The representation of the behaviour or characteristics of one system through the use of another system, especially a computer program designed for the purpose.

It defines ‘arcade’ as:-
An establishment, public area, etc., containing games of a mechanical and electronic type, as pinball and video games, that can be played by a customer for a fee.

I would say with a fair amount of certainty that the sim-racing community does not use these definitions when labelling racing games under one of these two categories. So how do sim-racers see the difference? Well you can only find out by asking, so I did. Here are only a few responses…

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: If your a big fan of GTR2, GTR Evo, Race 07 or even rFactor, this is a MUST BUY. I've had this game since 2005, and I still adore it to this day, the magic of this game is still alive and well for me. All of the cars handle beautifully, tons of fun to drive, drifting around corners and on the limit. The wide range of cars you can choose from is fantastic as well, from your Mini Coopers to your Porsche 911's. And if that isn't enough, there's a great deal of mods you can choose from as well on various websites! Career mode is awesome as well, plenty to do and bags of fun. Only flaw I'd say with this game is that the AI can be derpy sometimes on a select few of tracks. ie Imola with the tyres. But about 80% of the time, there fine.\n\n9/10.

reviewText:
This one's pretty easy to recommend, if you have a steering wheel this is a must have title, simple as that, if you don't you should probably let it pass as you wont be able to enjoy it very much.

Based on the gmotor engine (same other SimBin titles, but with this one being the only one to feature an actual single player career), physics are very realistic (and considering you are driving classic cars with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ tyres, it's particularly fun to drive).
All cars feel different, with great force feedback and accurate, predictable reactions.

Graphics hold up surprisingly well, and the sound simply rocks.

Great title, fantastic car selection, fun driving, what's more to like?
